data.name: Rabine
data.description:
Rabine is a world class provider of innovative solutions for local and national property asset managers. We go far beyond surfacing a parking lot, laying a roof or snow removal. We are built on an unrivaled engineering foundation, creating meaningful advantage for you: the highest quality work - on time and in budget—planned and executed to maximize long term return on investment. 

Rabine services commercial, industrial, and utility customers that are local, regional, and national. Rabine encompasses multiple companies across industries dedicated to quality products and services for pavement and construction needs. Rabine companies include Rabine Paving, Rabine Paving Texas, Rabine Paving Mid-Atlantic, Rabine America, Pipe View America, Rabine Snow Pros, Rabine Mechanical, Rabine Doors & Docks, Crawford Roofing Experts, Rabine America Maintenance, and SITE.
 
Each Rabine company is guided by passionate team members. Our team strives to be the best in the industry by leveraging global networking and state of the art training. Our world-class team, above all else, is dedicated to providing the highest quality products and services to provide total customer satisfaction.

Crain’s Chicago Business recognizes Rabine as one of the largest privately held organizations, and as one of the “Fastest Fifty” growing companies in the Chicagoland area.
 
Rabine staff and their families are a charitably minded team and proudly participate in activities supported by the Rabine Foundation and TrueMentors, two non profit organizations started by Cheryl and Gary Rabine. The Rabine Foundation has a mission to support causes on behalf of children, elderly, disadvantaged, medical research, and veterans. TrueMentors is a mentorship network where high level leaders are matched with mentees seeking shared experiences to enhance their leadership growth.

Rabine.com

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: Rabine America is proud to have consulted on a huge roller compacted concrete project in Nuevo Laredo, Mexico. The work site was 25 acres and involved over 1 million sq. ft. of concrete. Rabine provided education, guidance, and quality control for many aspects of the project including design, testing, equipment, mix design, onsite plant strategy, and pavement processes.

company_updates_collection.description: Rabine America is proud to have consulted on a huge roller compacted concrete project in Nuevo Laredo, Mexico. The work site was 25 acres and involved over 1 million sq. ft. of concrete. Rabine provided education, guidance, and quality control for many aspects of the project including design, testing, equipment, mix design, onsite plant strategy, and pavement processes.

We are very lucky to be able to help support Refuge for Women Chicago with a new driveway. Rabine America Maintenance and Peter Baker & Son Co. were happy to partner up on this to support such an amazing organization.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Refuge for Women Chicago's Long Term Program Home is honored to have received a brand new, completely donated driveway from Rabine America, part of the Rabine Group!

The fully-donated project was accomplished with the help of many individuals and partners and included the removal and replacement of our severely compromised driveway, approximately 2,000 sq. ft. We also want to extend our thanks to Peter Baker & Son Co. for donating the asphalt!

It was a tremendous undertaking, requiring much planning and execution, and we’re still in awe of the generosity of the Rabine Group! Thank you again, from the bottom of our hearts, for your generosity, kindness, support, and skills! You're truly an answer to many prayers! 

Learn more about Rabine America at: https://lnkd.in/g83_y5cN

Austin Rabine Gary Rabine Jordain Malavolti Dan Gillette

See all the aerial-action from Rabine Paving Mid-Atlantic’s latest asphalt project from Smyrna, Delaware! Over 223,000 square feet of pavement was installed utilizing an innovative 100% recycled Aspahlt process called Cold-in-Place recycling. The existing asphalt is removed, crushed, and then recycled. This Encore product is produced on-site using a mobile plant to create the mix. It is then finished with 1.5 inches of new asphalt surface and finally restriped with new signage. This is the second Encore project Rabine has been part of in the last 2 years. #RabinePavingMidAtlantic

Rabine Paving performs work at a Blain’s Farm and Fleet in Elgin, IL this month. This exciting project includes a 2” mill and overlay and assistance in a Beta test program, with some new technology for mill control, in partnership with Trimble.

Rabine also hosted an after party event at X-Golf, extending the networking opportunities and enjoying the camaraderie with Rabine employees and clients.

Rabine is proud to announce the launch of the Rabine Compacted Concrete (RCC) website at https://lnkd.in/gT8EwfDC. This is for the newest addition to the Rabine family of companies and focuses on various applications for concrete installation, specifically roller-compacted concrete. Rabine Compacted Concrete services customers nationwide and is led by David Van Fleet. #rabinecompactedconcrete #rollercompactedconcrete

On Wednesday, Sept 20th, Rabine hosted a drone training event at their corporate office in Schaumburg. The session was an introduction into the Skydio brand drone taught by a few SITE team members. Employees from Rabine Paving, Rabine America, Rabine Paving Mid-Atlantic, and Rabine Paving Texas were in attendance as well as members from our Estimating, Operations, and Marketing Departments. The drone will be used to capture aerial footage of upcoming projects and will have the ability to upload digital maps to the SITE Technologies platform.

This Encore product is produced on-site using a mobile plant to create the mix. It is then finished with 1.5 inches of new asphalt surface and finally restriped with new signage. This is the second Encore project Rabine has been part of in the last 2 years. #RabinePavingMidAtlantic

Rabine teamed up with “It’s our Little Story” to provide Santa’s toys for their holiday party. The children got to enjoy family time with their new foster families and share with other children in a similar situation. “It’s Our Little Story” is a non-profit organization whose mission is to involve, educate, and empower abused, neglected and at-risk children and adolescents. www.Itsourlittlestory.org

Rabine Doors & Docks performed a unique project at a local shipping facility. The job included some new seals/shelters that allow trucks cushioning when backing into the docks. company_updates_collection.reshared_post_author_headline: AVP, Director of Operations at ICRES - Inland Commercial Real Estate Services LLC
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
A big thank you to Bill Shanko and the Rabine  team for stepping up on a complex paving project at Fairgrounds Crossing in Hot Springs, AR. When we needed a new vendor to step in last minute before construction blackout periods started, they mobilized quickly and delivered. The project finished on time, within budget, and with zero tenant complaints — true professionalism in action! 

Fairgrounds Crossing is expertly managed by ICRES - Inland Commercial Real Estate Services LLC property management team of Kyle Blume & Janet L. Wegener.

Interested in 3rd party management for your properties?  Drop me a DM, I know some people.

company_updates_collection.description: Rabine wants to recognize the outstanding job performed by Dave Walko and Landon Willis at the BNSF facility in Lincoln, Nebraska this month. This project presented many challenges that our dynamic team was able to overcome. The team remained positive and continued to work well with our partners and upheld the highest standards of safety and continuous process improvement. Rabine would also like to thank Todd Fehsel and Tom Varkalis for assisting in answering questions and helping source much needed materials. Also, Bobby McFarland assisted tremendously with the logistical items and helped us stay on top of this amazing project! A big thank-you to everyone involved! Our client thanked us for our hard work and was very satisfied with our all our efforts!

Rabine will be at this year’s PAVE/X in Chattanooga, TN Jan 28-30. Come visit us at our Booth#1207! https://www.pavexshow.com/

Rabine Paving Texas temporarily changed their name to Rabine “Plowing” Texas after an unprecedented snow storm dumped in the area this month. Luckily crews were able to handle the snow with ease and filled the gap until paving could resume. Great job RPTX for having the team and equipment to get the job done! #rabineplowstexas

A project well done by Rabine Paving Texas gets rave reviews from their customer. The job, which took place in Mansfield Texas included1,065 SF 8” Concrete RRBC 565 LF New B6/12 Curb Gutter, 5,640 SF Dirt restoration ,18,000 LF Concrete Joint seal, 270 LF 12” RCP Storm Pipe, and 598 SF New 8” Concrete Ramp and walls.  According to their happy client, “I want to thank you all for a project that is going as smooth as any I have done with my company in 8 years. Nick Wenzel and his crew are knocking this out of the park. The project is going as planned but even more, my site does not show that there is a major paving project going on. Everything has been kept clean, organized, barricaded properly. I just couldn’t ask for better. I am very pleased!”

A project well done by Rabine Paving Texas gets rave reviews from their customer. The job, which took place in Mansfield Texas included1,065 SF 8” Concrete RRBC 565 LF New B6/12 Curb Gutter, 5,640 SF Dirt restoration ,18,000 LF Concrete Joint seal, 270 LF 12” RCP Storm Pipe, and 598 SF New 8” Concrete Ramp and walls.  According to their happy client, “I want to thank you all for a project that is going as smooth as any I have done with my company in 8 years. Nick Wenzel and his crew are knocking this out of the park. The project is going as planned but even more, my site does not show that there is a major paving project going on. Everything has been kept clean, organized, barricaded properly. I just couldn’t ask for better. I am very pleased!”

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
A big thank you to Bill Shanko and the Rabine  team for stepping up on a complex paving project at Fairgrounds Crossing in Hot Springs, AR. When we needed a new vendor to step in last minute before construction blackout periods started, they mobilized quickly and delivered. The project finished on time, within budget, and with zero tenant complaints — true professionalism in action! 

Fairgrounds Crossing is expertly managed by ICRES - Inland Commercial Real Estate Services LLC property management team of Kyle Blume & Janet L. Wegener.

Interested in 3rd party management for your properties?  Drop me a DM, I know some people.

company_updates_collection.description: Rabine wants to recognize the outstanding job performed by Dave Walko and Landon Willis at the BNSF facility in Lincoln, Nebraska this month. This project presented many challenges that our dynamic team was able to overcome. The team remained positive and continued to work well with our partners and upheld the highest standards of safety and continuous process improvement. Rabine would also like to thank Todd Fehsel and Tom Varkalis for assisting in answering questions and helping source much needed materials. Also, Bobby McFarland assisted tremendously with the logistical items and helped us stay on top of this amazing project! A big thank-you to everyone involved! Our client thanked us for our hard work and was very satisfied with our all our efforts!
